movie_title: Could you give up fast fashion? 6 Minute English
introduction: Lots of people are planning to buy no new clothes this year, favouring second-hand or making do with

vocabulary.example: She is pledging to buy no new clothes this year.

vocabulary.definition: given to another company to do, often to save costs or utilize specific skills
vocabulary.example: The production of the shoes was outsourced to a factory in China.

vocabulary.definition: charges less to do a job than a competitor
vocabulary.example: The new company undercuts its rivals to attract more customers.

vocabulary.definition: not reasonable or sensible; driven by emotions rather than practicality
vocabulary.example: Her decision to quit her stable job seemed illogical to her friends.

vocabulary.definition: is caused by; a result of
vocabulary.example: The increase in pollution stems from the excessive use of cars.

vocabulary.definition: a strong negative reaction to something
vocabulary.example: The new policy received a backlash from the employees.
